task_summary: Open the kitchen cabinet door using a robotic arm by detecting, approaching, actuating, and confirming the open state of the door.

task_long_description.overview: A robot is instructed to open the door of a kitchen cabinet. The environment includes an upper cabinet, counter, sink, and robot arm. The task involves visually locating the cabinet door, aligning to grasp or push/pull, applying actuation to open the door, verifying it is open, and retreating. Physical constraints include limited workspace and precise maneuvering around the cabinet and counter surfaces.
preconditions: Robot gripper is not holding any object.
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to the cabinet door.
Open the cabinet door with the proper action.
Retreat the arm from the cabinet front.
success_criteria: Cabinet door is open at the end of the episode.
Robot arm returns to safe pose.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect door — rescan using ScanForTarget.
Failure to open container — retry action if possible.
Blocked motion or collision — abort and retreat.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate upon confirmed open state of the cabinet door and arm retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the cabinet door is visible in the robot's sensors.
Actively scans the environment for the cabinet door using a raster pattern.
Performs object detection to localize the cabinet door.
Moves and aligns the robot end-effector to the cabinet door with moderate precision.
Carries out the opening action for the cabinet door, actuating the container.
Checks that the cabinet door is in the open state.
Moves the arm away from the work area after the door is open.

recovery_strategy: Retreat from workspace after failed open
assumptions: Instruction spelling ('carbinet') interpreted as 'cabinet' per context and dataset.
Frame sequence shows opening a top-hinged or right-hinged upper cabinet; the handle is on the right.
No explicit force, speed, or retry request in instruction; selected default bins.
Frames support the opening of a cabinet, not a drawer or other container type.
No intermediate grasp or fine manipulation observed; actuation is direct.
Retreat included for safety per standard kitchen manipulation protocol.

expected_success_criteria: Cabinet door is visibly open in final frame.
Robot arm does not block opening and returns to neutral.
